p: For Kampo drugs, 90 µl of a drug at a concentration ranging from 20.6 to 24.5 mg/ml was mixed with 10 µl of a virus solution of 6.3 × 10 8 TCID 50/ml and incubated for 3 min at room temperature. The mixture was then 10-fold serially diluted with DMEM, and infectivity in the solution was measured by the TCID 50 method. For crude drugs, a reagent at a concentration of 12.5 mg/ml was used. Ethanol (70%) was used for an inactivating control.
